revised_title: Fossil Plant Organization and Seed Structures in Coal Measures
tldr: The author examines the organization of fossil plants, specifically ferns and gymnospermous stems and seeds, found in coal measures. They describe various structures and seed types, such as Lagenostoma and Conostoma, and discuss their possible affinities with modern plant groups. The author also addresses the classification of Sigillaria and the internal structures of seeds from St. Etienne, France.
